# Start with the Getting Started With Data Visualization Desktop Notebook

    NOTE: The Self-Service Analytics tutorials are under construction.  Please start with the notebook "Tutorial 4c: Getting Started with Data Visualization Desktop" which is
    part of the New Data Lake journey.  That notebook is more up-to-date than this one.

msg.data:
Start with the Getting Started With Data Visualization Desktop Notebook

NOTE: The Self-Service Analytics tutorials are under construction.  Please start with the notebook "Tutorial 4c: Getting Started with Data Visualization Desktop" which is
part of the New Data Lake journey.  That notebook is more up-to-date than this one.

paragraphs.text: %md # Working with Oracle Data Visualization Desktop and CitiBike Data This tutorial was built for BDCS-CE version 17.3.3-20 as part of the Self Service BI User Journey: here. Questions and feedback about the tutorial: Note: This tutorial assumes you have tables defined in the Hive metastore which you should have if you ran the earlier tutorials. Oracle Data Visualization Desktop ( here ) is a lightweight, single-file download tool to easily analyze data. Data Visualization Desktop can connect to a variety of data sources. In this tutorial, we will show you how you can use it to securely connect to BDCS-CE. We will connect via DV Desktop's support for Spark. Please follow the instructions in the xtra Connecting DV Desktop and Hive for the DVD download and install instructions.

msg.data:
Working with Oracle Data Visualization Desktop and CitiBike Data

This tutorial was built for BDCS-CE version 17.3.3-20 as part of the Self Service BI User Journey: here. Questions and feedback about the tutorial: david.bayard@oracle.com

Note: This tutorial assumes you have tables defined in the Hive metastore which you should have if you ran the earlier tutorials.

Oracle Data Visualization Desktop ( here ) is a lightweight, single-file download tool to easily analyze data. Data Visualization Desktop can connect to a variety of data sources. In this tutorial, we will show you how you can use it to securely connect to BDCS-CE. We will connect via DV Desktop’s support for Spark.

Please follow the instructions in the xtra Connecting DV Desktop and Hive for the DVD download and install instructions.

paragraphs.text: %md # Working with CitiBike Data Off Line This first lab uses a starter project that has imported the CitiBike 12-2016 data in as a CSV file. Take a look at the Prepare Tab. With CSV all data headers come in automatically. Longitude and Latitude come in as Doubles and much be converted to Attributes to work with the mapping functions. Additional fields can be added in the Prepare Tab. Male/Female is an example of this. Download the CitiBike DVD Project. There are three files. Download all three and unzip. CitiBikeOffline.zip.001 CitiBikeOffline.zip.002 CitiBikeOffline.zip.003 **Note: the three files are pieces of the same zip file. To unzip using the 7-zip tool, right-click on the .001 file and choose 7-Zip->Open Archive. You only have to do this for the .001 file, the 7-Zip tool knows to look for the .002 and .003 piece in the same directory.** Download the custom map plugins, there are 2 files used. Do not unzip. customviz-com-company-heatMapViz.zip customviz-com-company-pointsMapViz.zip + Open up DV Desktop + From the home page click on the 3 dots on the top right and select Import + Either drag and drop the file on the import page or find the CitiBikeOffline.dva + Password is Admin123 ![Import Project](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/oracle/learning-library/master/workshops/journey1-self-service-bi/images/100/DVDImportCitiBikeProject1.jpg "HODBC") From the main screen go to the Console. You can drag and drop the customer pugins or use the file feature to find them. ![Add Custom Plugins](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/millerhoo/journey1-self-service-bi/master/workshops/journey1-self-service-bi/images/100/DVDCustomPlugins.jpg "HODBC")

msg.data:
Working with CitiBike Data Off Line

This first lab uses a starter project that has imported the CitiBike 12-2016 data in as a CSV file. Take a look at the Prepare Tab. With CSV all data headers come in automatically. Longitude and Latitude come in as Doubles and much be converted to Attributes to work with the mapping functions. Additional fields can be added in the Prepare Tab. Male/Female is an example of this.

Download the CitiBike DVD Project. There are three files. Download all three and unzip.
CitiBikeOffline.zip.001
CitiBikeOffline.zip.002
CitiBikeOffline.zip.003
Note: the three files are pieces of the same zip file. To unzip using the 7-zip tool, right-click on the .001 file and choose 7-Zip->Open Archive. You only have to do this for the .001 file, the 7-Zip tool knows to look for the .002 and .003 piece in the same directory.

Download the custom map plugins, there are 2 files used. Do not unzip.
customviz-com-company-heatMapViz.zip
customviz-com-company-pointsMapViz.zip

  • Open up DV Desktop
  • From the home page click on the 3 dots on the top right and select Import
  • Either drag and drop the file on the import page or find the CitiBikeOffline.dva
  • Password is Admin123

From the main screen go to the Console. You can drag and drop the customer pugins or use the file feature to find them.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# DVD Exploration
The purpose of this step is to become more familier with DVD. We can use this simple data set to learn how to work with filters and the basic visualizations.  Look at the data in different ways to see what pattens you can uncover.  Friday nights(early morning) at 2:00AM are revealing! 

+ Click on the Prepare Tab and reivew the imported data.  Take a look at the Male/Female column
+ Click back on the Visualize Tab.  You should see 4 predefined view. Each view is a starter view for exploring the data.

![DVD Prepare Tab](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/oracle/learning-library/master/workshops/journey1-self-service-bi/images/100/DVDPrepare.jpg "HODBC")

+ From the Visualize tab take a look at MyCalculation. Calculated fields can range from simple to complex includeing the use of custom pluging, R scripts and other extensions.  Basic calcuations have been added to this project.

![DVD Visualize Tab](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/oracle/learning-library/master/workshops/journey1-self-service-bi/images/100/DVDMyCalcs.jpg "HODBC")

+ On the first tab experiment with the filters. Change Weekdays to Weekend -what does this tell you? Change Male/Female with Rider Age. DVD is a tool to explor the data. See what kind of patterns you can uncover!
 
![DVD Explore](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/oracle/learning-library/master/workshops/journey1-self-service-bi/images/100/DVDExplore.jpg "HODBC")
![DVD Filter](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/oracle/learning-library/master/workshops/journey1-self-service-bi/images/100/DVDFilter.jpg "HODBC")

+ Contiune exploration on each tab
+ The Timeline tab is slow to come up due to the number of points in the data. You can use filters to narrow it down.  It is a intersting visual.
+ The Custom Maps are also very dense.  You can drill down to see more details.

msg.data:
DVD Exploration

The purpose of this step is to become more familier with DVD. We can use this simple data set to learn how to work with filters and the basic visualizations. Look at the data in different ways to see what pattens you can uncover. Friday nights(early morning) at 2:00AM are revealing!

  • Click on the Prepare Tab and reivew the imported data. Take a look at the Male/Female column
  • Click back on the Visualize Tab. You should see 4 predefined view. Each view is a starter view for exploring the data.

  • From the Visualize tab take a look at MyCalculation. Calculated fields can range from simple to complex includeing the use of custom pluging, R scripts and other extensions. Basic calcuations have been added to this project.

  • On the first tab experiment with the filters. Change Weekdays to Weekend -what does this tell you? Change Male/Female with Rider Age. DVD is a tool to explor the data. See what kind of patterns you can uncover!


  • Contiune exploration on each tab
  • The Timeline tab is slow to come up due to the number of points in the data. You can use filters to narrow it down. It is a intersting visual.
  • The Custom Maps are also very dense. You can drill down to see more details.

paragraphs.text: %md # Working with CitiBike Data Using Spark This nextlab uses a starter project that has connection to the CitiBike 12-2016 data in BDCSCE through Spark. Take a look at the Prepare Tab. With Spark the hearders all need to be updated to make the names more readable. Each field should be reviewed to verify the data type. all data headers come in automatically. Additional fields can be added in the Prepare Tab. Male/Female is an example of this. Download the CitiBike DVD Project here + Open up DV Desktop + From the home page click on the 3 dots on the top right and select Import + Either drag and drop the file on the import page or find the CitiBikeSpark.dva + Password is Admin123 ![DVD Import Spark Project](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/oracle/learning-library/master/workshops/journey1-self-service-bi/images/100/DVDImportCitiBikeProject1.jpg "HODBC") + Once the project in imported, go into the Data Sources and Connections to change the host name and port to your BDCSCE instance. User name and password will also need to be update. + Go into the data sources and verify that that table name that was imported matches your table name. ![Connection](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/oracle/learning-library/master/workshops/journey1-self-service-bi/images/100/DVDSparkConnection.jpg "HODBC") ![Spark Data Source](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/oracle/learning-library/master/workshops/journey1-self-service-bi/images/100/DVDSparkDataSource.jpg "HODBC")

msg.data:
Working with CitiBike Data Using Spark

This nextlab uses a starter project that has connection to the CitiBike 12-2016 data in BDCSCE through Spark. Take a look at the Prepare Tab. With Spark the hearders all need to be updated to make the names more readable. Each field should be reviewed to verify the data type. all data headers come in automatically. Additional fields can be added in the Prepare Tab. Male/Female is an example of this.

Download the CitiBike DVD Project here

  • Open up DV Desktop
  • From the home page click on the 3 dots on the top right and select Import
  • Either drag and drop the file on the import page or find the CitiBikeSpark.dva
  • Password is Admin123

  • Once the project in imported, go into the Data Sources and Connections to change the host name and port to your BDCSCE instance. User name and password will also need to be update.
  • Go into the data sources and verify that that table name that was imported matches your table name.
